messageSequence.content: UNLOCKED: A Bloody Severed Leg
Liz says: Dear internet person, you have found A Severed Leg

Your body watches you

And you peer back

Silent drips of blood

A wounded unwanted mind

How often do you allow your mind to think?

The body is so gragile,

So flight or fight, bby!

Inward or outward?

choices.text: << You say to youreself: Who am I really listening to? >>

messageSequence.content: UNLOCKED: A Forgotten Thought
Liz says: Dear internet person, you have found A Forgotten Thought

Focused in on this universe

Everything breathes

Into a single moment.

And then you blink...

eternityevaporatesflipsreverses

crys out

and then laughs

half-eaten

tip of the tongue,

a smothering darkness

It's just a feeling, but

she still has power

To sew broken images

and tell you, "this is your memory"

and these broken images love to play!

they're so mischevious.

Perhaps because they believe between a moment ago and the past

it was all a fascade.

choices.text: << You ask: What will I remember tonight? >>

messageSequence.content: UNLOCKED: Dust?
Liz says: Dear internet person, you have found A Pile of Dust..?

The Body

Your body

left without touch

What is it asking for?

The dust gathers around your feet,

And (uh) she's winking now.

What have you not embraced?

Sometimes the silliest things add distraction.

choices.text: << You say: Is this a reward or a warning? What is my body telling me? >>

messageSequence.content: UNLOCKED: A Stranger's Smile
Liz says: Dear internet person, you have found A Stranger's Smile

A flirtatious smile

A curious glance

A cryptic message

A non physical embrace

A crowd of curious bodies

Watching

You

Right Now.

Your body perks

And pockets this stranger’s smile

For a grim day.

choices.text: << You wonder as you depart: Who was that? >>

an_email_marked_as_untitled_it_looks_bac.text:
The shy email, looks at the floor, then back at you before it slowly opens, obeyingly. It reminds you of a time you felt like both a child, but obligated to someone. In that moment, were you abiding by some kind of code and disconnecting from something deeper? This choice has made you reflective and the email(text-colour:grey)[ will be remember that]

The email reads:

Dear [the name is blurred out],

sO formal sorry! I couldn't find your account to message directly and so I wondered if you deactivated? Anyways, I did wnt to invte you you a c0nc3rt - hehe! I'll bring a few of the following items

...''A mirror..

..Poorer eyesight...

..A telepathic printer

Do you want any? Anyway, msg me back before the weekend.

xo

> You say: Maybe best to close this and head back into the portal of

>You say: A riddle?

> You say: OKKKK weaker eyes? Lol... Weaker eyes. A trap, but

> You say:  sounds intruiging.

choices.text: a place of tension and expression.
In this moment, I would like to guess "a mirror"
Yeah, it feels like a complete fascade to me, makes me itch.

narratorMessages: Liz says: Oh, There are a few outcomes of parts of yourself that you can find at the end. Remember, how you play the game says something about you, almost like an adventerous survey, or how the world around you response how you react to it.  If I speak in bold letters like before, it changes quite dramatically the route, ok? And well tbh, sometimes there will be no bolding but dramatic changes ;)

messageSequence.content: Liz: Now internet person, what would you like to search next? Where does your curiousity lead you?

choices.text: Search: What has the internet taught me about love?
Search: How do I poliltely ask someone to sleep with me?
Search: What is the best way to search for yourself online?
Search: Where is the centre of the internet?
Search: How to find a place for everything

narratorMessages: Liz says: ...Transmitting...Thread...Loading....Pic and... Lonely Thread...

Liz says: Last thing. Use your imagination, your internal eye throughout, many different people play this but the spaces are always different, the text will trigger images for you to envision. Don't feel rushed to take a moment to close your eyes and imagine the space you're in. Take your time as you want.

messageSequence.content: UNLOCKED: Inherited Recipe
Liz says: Dear internet person, you have found An Inherited Recipe

Archieves inside flesh like a forgotten dream

A torn photo, a floppy disk.

A gift from your bloodline sending nourishment you can't smell

But you can feel.

It's telling you to 'slow down'

and other words you can no longer decode.

maybe this isn't a meal at all,

but a message

you chew on this thought of what this bowl of soup and what your body are telling you.

choices.text: << you leave this chat with reflection to slow down>>

narratorMessages: Liz says: Yes, you are a body of cyberspace I believe? I'm so glad to meet you.

lol_gosh_i_mean_ummmmm_maybe_in_a_weird_.text:

SSS_98 whispers: Well, let me log the coordinates for you.

choices.text: I'm ready to go whereever next, I suppose!

narratorMessages: Liz says: I won't really be able to help you take everything, but this will be a short (5 to 10 minute) symbolic experience. Relax, we'll find the parts of yourself, your body that you lost. Good luck.

messageSequence.content: UNLOCKED: Nail Clippings!
Liz says: Dear internet person, you have found Nail Clippings

Little forgotten pieces

From your body

The parts the world deemed unworthy

imperfect

a clause you were taught somewhere between

your queerness and spirituality

Click-Click-Opps!

What ifour body parts were alive?

Can you imagine those little bones

dancing-conciously-laughing on hills

Free from the pain of being unwanted

What did you accidentally believe in?

no_i_haven_t_really_thought_about.text: No, I haven't really thought about
narratorMessages: Liz says: *looks at your disappointed* I suppose I'm not surprised. However, I don't want to throw you off. In this new age, there is a necessity for vigilance...you may or may not agree, Internet Person!
Liz says: Regardless. Ur curiousity is valuable, it's a real strength.
Liz says: So perhaps it's time to begin the growth of this thought now, no?

narratorMessages: Liz says: Through this screen and mouse you are connecting your physical body to this chatroom, a quiet central station in cyberspace. You can connect with different locations between the web, the inbetween spaces. When you put on a pair of glasses, you see clearer, but imagine this and you can see parts of the web that very few have. However, there was a reason this chatroom was created and there's a reason of course why you're here :)

Pure bio humans love to take photos of themselves. Have you ever thought about how much of your energy - your information exists out there, beyond your control? messageSequence.content: UNLOCKED: An Evil Eye
Liz says: Dear internet person, you have found An Evil Eye

A side eye, an echoed chuckle

an eye for extraction

Your eyes turn inward

Reminding itself,

"you have not moved your body the same since --"

Did you invite this gaze?

Undetected for so long 'til now,

a painful thought, transformed

SSSS_98 says: Who owns these tools? I am black. I'm hypersexual. I don't have many friends. I want my body on display and I wonder if this was a learned behavior - hell does it matter?

read_final_comment_from_ssss_98.text:
SSSS_98 says: Hello? Is anyone there? I keep seein a lot of activity on my other posts/other's threads the past couple of days, but I can't tell what's going on like is this even visible?

Can you all see this?

Can you all see me?

Are you really there?

choices.text: Hey!1 Yeah I'm here :)) I can't see what you're saying but I can see these words
Hello. I'm here. I hope this message reaches you in time.

read_on.text:
SSSS_98 says: I've never really thought about it before but, I guess I'm grateful for this kind of thread space to kind of tune out of the world, I feel like I'm kind of growing up and learning about myself with all of this information around me.

I'm curious to know what others think.

read_thread.text:
Thread Topic: Jouissance.

SSSS_98 says: Hey everyone, has anyone seen this image floating around on here? It keeps coming up for me, like a lot. I had to start a convo about it as so many thoughts and questions keep coming up for me around my relationship with my own body.

The first time I saw the image, it felt like a kind of optical illusion, if I blinked the image looked slightly different and it kind of tripped me out.

The second time, I think I started to really focus in on the vaginal area. I thought of my own gentalia and my body as a machine of pleasure and loss. Objectification and beauty. I
narratorMessages: Liz says: ..Here's the thread below that followed the image.

messageSequence.content: Liz says: New sphere transportation complete.

Liz says: There's a hypnotic feeling of repetition here in this sphere. A pattern repeated by millions, the ask and search pattern, the feeling that there are never enough conclusive answers in the world. This leaves your body aimless if you're not careful.

Remember, you are looking for yourself, you have three chances only here to make your selection in this search - what topic is most important to you? Search, receive riddles, and respond to them to help you travel on.

telepathic_printer.text:
...an email;

"I can't believe it's almost 2010!

Time has flown by -

HmmmmM

It's almost 2 in the morning,

and the deep quiet and the soothing pace of tumblr is really

really allowing me to reflect on like,

these websites - public digital rooms,

we're all sharing parts of ourselves here

and we're all apart of something

I wonder if one day the internet will be...

> You say:

> You say:

>  as in fact, what is there to say? You haven't quite swallowed your feelings of the past and your relaionship.

choices.text: ...still a place  place of sancutary, like it was in the past...
...an archieve, or perhaps a graveyard...a museum?

narratorMessages: Liz: The email closes it's eyes a little bit, the printer symbol on the email begins to dance and spits out --
Liz says: The email sort of fades away after that. I wonder how you will finish this unanswered email and what this choice means to you?
